intro: Aconogonon zaravschanicum, commonly known as the Zaravshan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is found in mountainous regions. It has slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
